   Ensuring equitable access to quality education reduces disparities and provides opportunities for all individuals to contribute to society. Inclusive education systems help bridge social and economic gaps, enhancing overall resilience.

In summary, an ideal education system contributes to societal resilience by fostering critical thinking, inclusivity, civic engagement, lifelong learning, ethical values, emotional resilience, technological literacy, and equitable access. These elements collectively empower individuals and communities to navigate challenges and adapt to a changing world.
